title: With Rs 4800 at a certain rate of compound interest in 3 years, what will be its amount after the end of 4.5 years? - Quora

response.answer_text: Given Principal(P) =₹4800 Assuming Rate of interest = R% Then amount (A)= P(1+R/100)^n But considering half yearly it become R=r/2 and n is doubled Hence For 3yrs R=r/2 and n=6 So A1=P(1+r/200)^6 Or, (1+r/200)^6=A1/P Similar For 4.5 years R=r/2 and n=9 So A=P(1+r/200)^9 Or A=P*A1/P*{(1+r/200)^3}, Or A=A1*{(1+r/200)^3} Therefore, C.I = A-2P
